alert.note: Alert for Adair; Adams; Audubon; Carroll; Cass; Clarke; Crawford; Decatur; Guthrie; Madison; Ringgold; Sac; Taylor; Union; Wayne (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 09 at 3:17PM CST until January 09 at 6:00PM CST by NWS DesMoines
info.description: ...Moderate Snowfall and Breezy Winds Continues West This Afternoon and Evening... .Snow is steadily tapering off from west to east this afternoon, with moderate to heavy snowfall still falling over the eastern half of the area this afternoon. Snowfall accumulations of 6 to 12 inches have been reported over much of central and southern Iowa, with slightly lower accumulations of 2 to 4 inches over far northern Iowa. Additional accumulations of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the eastern portions of the forecast area, with snow mostly finished up further north and west. Snow will continue in the eastern portions of Iowa through the rest of the afternoon before diminishing this evening. Wind gusts of 35 to 45 mph are prolonging the travel impacts throughout the area, as blowing snow causes reduced visibility and snow recollecting on roadways. The most hazardous travel still resides in the eastern portions of the state, where falling snow and gusty winds are creating low visibility on already poor roadways. Further west, road conditions have begun to improve, but blowing and drifting snow will continue to impact travel through the rest of the afternoon. Stay off roads if you can, especially in eastern Iowa, and if you must be out, use extra caution. Winds will diminish through the evening. ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM CST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Light snow gradually ending from west to east with little new accumulation expected. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. Blowing snow expected, even after falling snow concludes. * WHERE...Eastern into Southern Iowa. * WHEN...From now until 6 PM CST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Travel will likely be difficult at times. Patchy blowing snow will reduce visibility, perhaps significantly at times. Hazardous conditions will linger into the evening commute.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, extra clothing or blankets, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. For the latest travel conditions, check the Iowa 511 app, www.511ia.org, or dial 511.
